files.patch:
@@ -6,5 +6,4 @@
-...
-
-Release Notes.
-
-...
+APIDiff is a utility to compare two or more versions of an API, each as
+defined by a series of options similar to those supported by `javac`.
+For details on all the options, see the file 'doc/apidiff.html' in this
+distribution.
@@ -20,1 +19,1 @@
-
+    It should be at least as recent as that for each of the APIs to be compared.
@@ -30,1 +29,1 @@
-legal/          Copyright and license files
+legal/          Additional copyright and license files
@@ -32,1 +31,1 @@
-bin/            Miscellaneous utility script for use on Linux, macOS, Solaris
+bin/            Miscellaneous utility script for use on Linux, macOS,

@@ -25,2 +25,2 @@ -title: 'APIDIFF(1) 0.1 | CodeTools' -date: 2021 +title: 'APIDIFF(1) 1.0 | CodeTools' +date: 2024 @@ -30,2 +30,0 @@ -WORK IN PROGRESS - @@ -38,1 +36,0 @@ - @@ -47,1 +44,1 @@ -of an API, compares corresponding files in the different versions and writes out +of an API, compares corresponding declarations in the different versions and writes out @@ -342,1 +339,1 @@ -`--source-path`, `--module-source-path`, `--module-path` and related options. +`--source-path`, `--module-source-path`, `--module-path`, and related options. @@ -351,1 +348,3 @@ -although that is not a requirement. +although that is not a requirement. To eliminate any false positive differences +being introduced by changes to the `javadoc` tool itself, the same or equivalent +versions of `javadoc` should be used for each API to be compared.
